column6: Once I had cleaned the studio and gone to the fish stalls or the Meat Hall I began again on the laundry, one day sorting, soaking and working on stains, another day scrubbing, rinsing, boiling and wringing before hanging things to dry and be bleached in the noon sun, another day ironing and mending and folding.
column7: Jakmile jsem uklidila ateliér a došla do rybárny nebo do Masných krámů, znovu jsem začala s prádlem - jeden den jsem je třídila, namáčela a čistila skvrny, druhý den jsem je valchovala, máchala, vyvářela a ždímala, pak jsem jednotlivé kusy věšela, aby na poledním slunci uschly a vybělily se, a další den jsem je žehlila, spravovala a skládala.

column6: Although he went out a great deal - in part to escape Franciscus ' crying - I always seemed to be coming in the front door as he was leaving, or coming down the stairs as he was going up, or sweeping the Crucifixion room when he was looking for Maria Thins there.

column6: After that I thought he would begin to paint what he saw - a girl 's face, a blue skirt, a yellow and black bodice, a brown map, a silver pitcher and basin, a white wall.

column6: I had just placed the tongue in the meat barrel in one of the storage rooms - Tanneke had left it out and the cat had almost got to it - when he appeared from outside, standing in the doorway at the end of the long hall, wearing his hat and cloak.
column7: Právě jsem uložila jazyk do soudku na maso v jedné ze špižíren - Tanneke ho totiž předtím nechala volně ležet, takže se k němu málem dostala kočka -, když se zvenku vynořil on, v klobouku a v plášti, a zastavil se ve dveřích na konci dlouhé chodby.
